SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.queue

Class PersistentQueue<T extends Serializable>

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.queue.PersistentQueue<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of items stored in the queue, must be Serializable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class PersistentQueue<T extends Serializable> extends Object implements Closeable
A persistent FIFO queue that delegates to a QueueDatabase implementation.

Uses the Factory pattern to allow different database backends (MapDB, MariaDB, PostgreSQL, or InMemory). Backend selection is configuration-driven via QueueFactory.

This class implements the Singleton pattern. All code should use getInstance() to obtain the queue instance, which will be backed by the configured database implementation.

  • Constructor Details

    • PersistentQueue

      private PersistentQueue()
      Constructs a new PersistentQueue instance.

      Private constructor to enforce singleton pattern. Uses Factories.getQueueDatabase() which delegates to QueueFactory.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PersistentQueue<RelaySession> getInstance()
      Get the singleton instance of PersistentQueue using configuration-based backend selection.

      The backend is selected by QueueFactory based on configuration in queue.json5. Backend priority: MapDB → MariaDB → PostgreSQL → InMemory.

      Returns:
      The PersistentQueue instance

    • enqueue

      public PersistentQueue<T> enqueue(T item)
      Add an item to the tail of the queue.
      Parameters:
      item - Item to enqueue
      Returns:
      Self for method chaining

      Remove and return the head of the queue, or null if empty.
      Returns:
      The head item or null if empty

    • peek

      public T peek()
      Peek at the head without removing.
      Returns:
      The head item or null if empty

      public boolean isEmpty()

      Returns:

    • snapshot

      public List<T> snapshot()
      Take a snapshot copy of current values for read-only inspection (e.g., service/health).
      Returns:
      Immutable list of all items currently in the queue

    • removeByIndex

      public boolean removeByIndex(int index)
      Remove an item from the queue by index (0-based).
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the item to remove
      Returns:
      true if item was removed, false if index was out of bounds

      Returns:

      Remove an item from the queue by UID (for RelaySession).
      Parameters:
      uid - The UID of the item to remove
      Returns:

      Returns:
      Number of items successfully removed

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clear all items from the queue.

    • close

      public void close()
      Close the database and reset the singleton instance.

      After calling close(), the next call to getInstance() will create a new instance.

      This method is synchronized to prevent race conditions with getInstance().

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
